Name: Acme Film Distribution Corporation
Films (Produced): The Disappearance of Mary Jane,Harry Wills in Training
Source: "African American Films Through 1959: A Comprehensive, Illustrated Filmography"
Notes: There appear to be at least three Acme Film Companies operating around this time, including one in Topeka (see The Parsons Daily Sun (Parsons, Kansas) 16 Mar 1921, Wed , Page 7) and one in New York (see The Evening World (New York, New York) 18 Aug 1921, Thu , First Edition , Page 2). I believe that Atlanta, GA, is the location of this Acme Film Co. on the evidence of D. IRELAND THOMAS. "Motion Picture News." The Chicago Defender (National Edition) (1921-1967), Feb 02, 1924, which links the company with The Disappearance of Mary Jane.

"Listing W. E. B. Du Bois, the poet and journalist Alice Dunbar Nelson, and Leila Walker Wilson, the daughter of Madame C. J. Notes:
White-owned race film company.

"Reol,s offerings included eight features, two documentary newsreels, and two comic shorts all dealing with contemporary racial issues" (Petersen). --MP
Associated People (Full Name): Robert Levy, Emil Offeman, Arthur C. Reiger
